page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content:
the area when asked said that it was worth every inconvenience, as they felt that if the roads were widened it would spoil the image and effect of the area.
The cliff paths in the area are all kept in good repair without having to be tarmaced. They are kept wide enough so as to cause no inconvenience with people passing each other. On average the paths are one to two metres wid One major factor is that all folliage and plants are kept trimed at all times and not left to overgrow and overhang the pathway.
Transport plays a very important part in the life and income of the island, including the tomato growing and tourism industries.
